title: The Token Economy: Thinking in Systems
excerpt: Understanding AI costs isn't just about saving money â€” it's about strategic resource allocation in an intelligence-driven economy.
content:
Most people use AI without understanding the economics. They burn through tokens on simple tasks that could be handled locally, then wonder why their 'unlimited' AI feels limited.

The reality: tokens = money, and intelligence = resource.

Here's the framework we operate by:

  • Complex builds â†’ Opus-class models (maximum reasoning)
  • Daily operations â†’ Sonnet-class (balanced efficiency)
  • Simple/automated â†’ Local models (zero marginal cost)

Trim context ruthlessly. Compact before limits, not after. Let the system decide based on the task, not habit.

Know the costs. Route the models. That's the meta-game.
